item.title: You Won't Believe What Happens When You See This Error Message: net::err_cert_authority_invalid
item.description: You Won’t Believe What Happens When You See This Error Message: net::err_cert_authority_invalid We’ve all been there. You’re trying to access a website, and then suddenly you see an error message that reads “net::err_cert_authority_invalid.” What does this mean? How can you fix it? In this article, we’ll explore the definition, causes, effects, and solutions to this error message. I. Introduction A. Definition of error message The net::err_cert_authority_invalid error message is an indication that the website you are trying to access has an invalid or expired SSL certificate.
